synonym.value: DDIMER(DVT/PE and DIC); DDIMER; L-DDEL; L-DD

orderindications.value: Low pretest probability for VTE or PE; Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)

cds.value: The pretest probability of the presence of VTE is the major factor determining the potential value of D-dimer measurement. D-dimer tests should only be ordered in patients with a low clinical probability after assessment with a well-validated clinical probability score guide, such as the Wells criteria. A low pretest probability and a negative D-dimer assay essentially rules out VTE and no further evaluation is indicated. In patients with an intermediate to high pretest probability of VTE, a d-dimer assay is not recommended initially because a negative result cannot safely exclude the diagnosis of VTE. Additional radiographic studies should be pursued to make a definitive diagnosis.

clinicianinstructions.value: Complete pretest probability scoring for VTE or PE prior to ordering.

mappingname.value: Fibrin D-dimer in Platelet poor plasma (order only)
